Consider the linear transformation $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, such that $F(x, y)=(x+2y, 2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$.
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$.

The Childfair Company has three plants producing child push chairs that are to be shipped to four distribution centers. Plants $1$, $2$, and $3$ produce $12$, $17$, and $11$ shipments per month, respectively. Each distribution center needs to receive $10$ shipments per month. The distance (in miles) from each plant ($i$) to the respective distributing centers ($j$) is given below:

\[
\begin{array}{c|c|c|c|c}
\text{Plant Dist. Center} & \text{1} & \text{2} & \text{3}  & \text{4}  \\
\text{1} & 800  & 1300 &  400 & 700\\
\text{2} & 1100 & 1400 &  600 & 1000 \\
\text{3} & 600  & 1200 &  800 & 900\\
\end{array}
\]	

The freight cost for each shipment is $100.50?$ per mile. Use the transportation simplex method to determine how much should be shipped from each plant to each of the distribution centers each month, to minimize the total shipping cost. Use the minimum cost rule to obtain an initial basic feasible solution.

answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$

Management wants to determine how many units of each product to produce so as to maximize profit. For each unit of product $1$, $1$ unit of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. For each unit of product $2$, $3$ units of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. The company has $200$ units of frame parts and $300$ units of electrical components. 

Each unit of product $1$ gives a profit of $1?$, and each unit of product $2$, up to $60$ units, gives a profit of $2?$. Any excess over	$60$ units of product $2$ brings no profit, so such excess has been ruled out.

question: Consider the equation $30=\pi h^2 \dfrac{9-h}{3}$ in the set $[2,3]$. Using Newton's method, how many iterations are needed to obtain an approximation to the solution with an absolute error less than $10^{-3}$.

answer1: $B$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $A$ isn't an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$

answer1: Numerical (quantitative), categorical (qualitative or nominal), and ordinal (ranked).

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 0 \\
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are $\left(\frac{5}{2}y,\,y,\,\frac{3}{2}y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(5,2,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
For every $m\in\mathbb{R}$, consider the line $r$ of equation $x+my=-3$ and the line $s$ of equation $mx+4y=6$.
Describe the mutual position of $r$ and $s$ with respect to the value of $m$.
answer1: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=-2$, parallel if $m=2$, and secant otherwise.
answer2: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=2$, parallel if $m=-2$, and secant otherwise.
answer3: The lines $r$ and $s$ are secant for every $m$.
answer4: The lines $r$ and $s$ are parallel for every $m$.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
4x & + & y & - & 5z & - & 3w & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x-y,\,x+y+1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{1}{3}+\frac{5}{3}z,\,\frac{4}{3}+\frac{2}{3}z,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has two solutions: $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ and $\left(0,\,2,\,-1\right)$.

question: Find $\displaystyle\int \dfrac{x^2+3x}{(x-4)^2(x-1)}\, dx$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
3x & - & y & - & 2z & = & a \\
-x & + & 3y & - & z & = & b \\
-2x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a \neq 1$ and $b \neq -1$.
If $a=1$ and $b=-1$, then the system has $\left(\frac{2+7z}{8},\,\frac{-2+5z}{8},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,1,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4:
The system has no solution if $a\neq 1$ and $b\neq 1$. 
If $a=b=1$, the system has $\left(1+y,\,y,\,\frac{3+y}{4}\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

answer1: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.
answer2: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.

answer1: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $7 m/s$.
answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.

x & - & y & + & 2z & - & 3t & = & 1 \\

x &- &3y &+ &z &- &2t &= &-1 \\
  &   &      &     &z &- &t &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(5,\,1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(5+20y,\,y,\,-10-13y,\,8+15y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(5,0,-10,8\right)$ as its unique solution.
